content: So, now that we've settled on what's needed for Input and Output, are we going to collapse into one resource with two profiles or leave as two resources. (And if the latter, what do we want to call them? My vote for names if we keep the split is "ImplementationGuideSource" and "ImplementationGuideManifest")
I think i prefer those being different things
but that is just because they would be on different ends of a machine.
Would we want that an ImplementationGuideManifest can be used as a Source?
transitioning to these is going to be interesting because of versioning issues... I think that authors will have to provide this in R4 version... but what do I produce for R3?
I vote for no changes in R3.
Well, certainly no change for May ballot
If this ballot indicates the intention to replace, we could implement that post May for R4 publication

I meant no changes for R3 Version IGs. I think R3 artifacts should be produced for R3 guides ( OK if R4 artifact created too) but I certainly don't want to have start using IGSource on an R3 base IG to maintain or edit.
I don't really have any choice about the input; I'm certainly not supporting multiple inputs
I'll probably have to produce both outputs - R3 and R4 - for R3 guides
I am talking about the inputs. but I see your point. :-(
first your are sunsetting spreadsheets and now no more ig.json - next is Jekyll
